reviewText:
ENW is a 2D action platformer many of us are often trying to find
Included are

-Secrets  (many but most seem to rely on the fake wall trick)
-Equips plus ingredients and recipes to make new equips
-Rescuing people who help rebuild your village and add new features to it
like Azure Dreams, Dark Cloud & Suikoden to name a few
-Multiple path stages with stage collect-a-thon goals

At the point of this writing the game pad works perfectly for the action side of things but
you'll want to stay close to a mouse when accessing menu screens.

I'm only four stages and fifteen minutes in but at this point I am highly impressed - most certainly feel
that I got my six bucks worth. Many other indies would've tried to push this for $15!

reviewText: I would first like to say that the Dev has been really active in getting proper controller support and polishing up other control issues.  My original was a not recommended"
date: but now that the issues have been addressed and I actually got some play-time in.  The game is not that bad
recommended:
pretty decent game.


Review:

The East new wolrd is a platformer type of game where you go from stage to stage fighting off enemies and earning jewls and gold to upgrade weapons and buy house items.  So the game can get pretty grindy as you replay the levels.
This is kinda alleviated by the character design
hoursPlayed: they have a charm about it and makes it fun to watch them fight.  Also the armor and weapon appearances change as you upgrade and they are cool-looking
voteText: kinda makes you want to keep playing and show-off the gear you have.\n\nI don't really have any major gripes with this game except control support
helpfulPercent: but the dev is still polishing it up and is becoming quite nice to use.\n\nFrom a hours to price ratio
votesHelpful: you'll get your money's worth or at least break-even.  The game is not too much and you will get enjoyment out of it.  But for long-term
votesTotal: that really depends if you like to grind for stuff
votesFunny: it'll take a while.\n\nOverall if you have some spare money give this game a try."

reviewText: I love this game - its fun, challenging, and particularly good if you consider yourself more of an old school gamer. It's reminiscent of the platformers from the 90's. I wish that the armor's were good for something other than appearances (If they are, I have yet to see the differences amongst them), but other than that minor thing, I highly recommend this!

reviewText:
the game on itself is good and cute

but it has some controllers issue , and the dev are offering an update in the future , so keep that on mind

Update :---------

the game is not cheap at all in it's fun factor.

the controls are responsive and fluid and the game play is as fun as 16 bit era platforming games , the levels are short but further you progress becomes Chalanging without the fustration of number of lifes lost but a counts of death prompt instead.

i recommend this game for any platforming lovers

i personally did not counter any bug or bad designe.

and the update fixed most controllers issues , and the dev are active.
